alert.note: Alert for Clay; Crawford; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 21 at 2:33PM CST until February 22 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following counties, Clay, Crawford, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...From Midnight CST tonight through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent rainfall and snowmelt has led to elevated streamflows on some regional rivers. New rainfall up to an inch will further exacerbate streamflows and river levels, and also lead to ponding of urban roadways and rural ditches. - You can monitor the latest river levels at water.weather.gov. For safety info, visit: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
